About Dan Kelley

Dan is a Professor of Oceanography at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. He teaches there, and is also the Graduate Coordinator. His research focuses on ocean mixing, especially that caused by internal waves and double-diffusive convection.

An official website at Dalhousie University provides contact information and (by university mandate) mentions just five publications. This is a sensible starting point for potential Honours, MSc or PhD students who would like to work with Dan.

Since potential students and colleagues will probably want to see his publications, Dan has subscribed to both ResearchGate and GoogleScholar. The ResearchGate website provides free PDFs of publications, along with citation counts that are so inaccurate that one wonders why they bother trying. By contrast, the Google-scholar website provides citation counts that seem more reasonable, but only publisher links to the papers, which means that readers will need to be at an institution that subscribes to the journals in which he has published.

Dan is the author of the Oce package for oceanographic analysis in R, and readers can follow its development, along with other things he makes public, by viewing his Github repositories.

In late 2013, Dan started experimenting with blogging, creating a WordPress blog. Finding the WordPress data entry scheme to be somewhat arduous, and disliking the lock-in to a commercial site, he migrated his posts to a GitHub blog in early 2014, and that is where he has blogged since.
